item.title: Research
item.description: Does literature advance “one funeral at a time”? Literature, as any artistic domain, is the field of constant innovation. New book genres, and sub-genres, pop up every several years. Why does this happen? Do these new genres reflect some important changes in the broader cultural and political landscape? Or do they reflect something else: a constant pendulum of demography? Could it be that the chnage in literature reflects the turnover of generations?
